document.docAuthor: Liu, Dong, Wu, Donghui & Chen, Jun
document.docTitle: Plonaphacarus protrusus Liu, Wu & Chen, 2011, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Plonaphacarus (Acari: Oribatida: Steganacaridae), with descriptions of eight new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Plonaphacarus (Acari: Oribatida: Steganacaridae), with descriptions of eight new species from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype : adult (in alcohol, W- 89 - 31 '), China : Fujian Province, Wuyi Mt. (
27 ° 45 ' 23.97 "N
,
118 ° 2 ' 7.11 "E
), Guadun, from litter under bamboo,
30 Apr.
, 1989 , leg. Hui-Fu Wang. Paratypes : two adults (in alcohol, W- 89 - 31 '), same data as holotype ; one adult (in alcohol, Wu-Y- 21 ), same data as holotype , Dazhulan, from litter under broadleaf,
31 Jul.
, 1983 , leg. Hui-Fu Wang and Xiao-Mei Zhang.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 41–49.
Plonaphacarus lanceolatus
sp. nov.
: 41, lateral view of body (legs removed); 42, prodorsum, dorsal view; 43, prodorsum, dorso-lateral view; 44, mentum of infracapitulum; 45, right side of ventral plate; 46–49, trochanter, femur, genu and tibia: 46, leg I; 47, leg II; 48, leg III; 49, leg IV. Scale bars=100μm.

FIGURES 50–58.
Plonaphacarus protrusus
sp. nov.
: 50, lateral view of body (legs removed); 51, prodorsum, dorsal view; 52, mentum of infracapitulum; 53, left side of ventral plate; 54, sensillus, dorsal view; 55–58, trochanter, femur, genu and tibia: 55, leg I; 56, leg II; 57, leg III; 58, leg IV. Scale bars: 50=200μm; 51–53, 55–58=100μm; 54=50μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The new specific name “
protrusus
” is from Latin, and refers to the protrudent part of notogaster.

Measurements: Holotype : Prodorsum: length 355 , width 280 , height 150 , setae: ss 140 , ro 50 , in 205 , le 75 , ex 44 , distance between setae: ro -ro 35 , in -in 90 , le -le 140 ; notogaster: length 842 , width 590 , height 549 ; setae: c
1
270 , c
2
228 , c
3
100 , c p 210 , d
1
230 , d
2
185 , e
1
200 , h
1
220 , h
3
97 , ps
1
208 , ps
2
200 , ps
3
130 , ps
4
70 ; distance between setae: c
1
-d
1
220 , d
1
-e
1
350 , e
1
-h
1
190 , h
1
-ps
1
140 ; ventral region: ad
1
148 , ad
2
160 , ad
3
50 , an
1
85 , an
2
102 ; genitoaggenital plate 195 × 180 , anoadanal plate 265 × 160 . One paratype : Prodorsum: length 298 , width 205 , height 95 ; notogaster: length 615 , width 340 , height 330 .
Colour grey-yellowish to brown. Surface of body covered with concavities.

Prodorsum with one remarkable dorsal carina; lateral carinae weakly developed and moderately long, not reaching sinus; sigillar fields invisible because of strong sculpture; posterior furrows present; sensilli long with narrow pedicel and sickle-like head, covered with small spines; interlamellar setae long, robust, semi-erect, densely covered with small spines; lamellar setae thin, short, semi-erect and densely barbed; rostral setae spiniform, thin, smooth and procumbent; exobothridial setae short and fine; comparative length: in>ss > le>ro > ex .

Anterodorsal part of notogaster protrudent to form a hook-like projection covering posterior part of prodorsum; 15 pairs of notogastral setae in different length and shape, setae c
3
, h
3
, ps
3
and ps
4
shorter and thinner, covered with spines in distal half (except setae c
3
densely barbed), other setae long ( c
1
> c
1
-d
1
), robust and densely barbed; setae c
1
and c
3
close to anterior border, setae c
2
more remote than them; vestigial setae f
1
positioned posterior to setae h
1
; two pairs of lyrifissures ia and im present.

Nine pairs of genital setae present, arranged in two rows with formula: 7 ( 4 + 3 ): 2 ; one pair of aggenital setae present; anoadanal plates each with five well-developed setae, setae ad
1
and ad
2
barbed, longer than anal setae, setae ad
3
shortest; setae an
2
longer than an
1
.

Setae h of mentum slightly longer than distance between them; chaetotaxy of legs (without tarsi): I: 1-4 - 2 ( 2 )- 5 ( 1 ); II: 1-3 - 2 ( 1 )- 3 ( 1 ), III: 2 - 2 - 1 ( 1 )- 2 ( 1 ), IV: 2 - 1 - 1-2 ( 1 ); v’’ / v’ (femora I)= 3 ; setae d on femora I forked distally and situated near distal end of article; setae a’’ on tarsi I and II and setae ft’’ on tarsi II straight distally; setae s and pv’ on tarsi IV and setae s on tarsi I and II present; setae l’ on genua IV reduced; setae d on tibiae IV long, independent of solenidions; all legs monodactylous.
Distribution. Known only from type locality.

Remark. This new species is similar to P. i n s i g n i t u s
Niedbała, 1989
and P. i s h ik aw a i (
Aoki, 1980
) in having one dorsal carina, but differs from them by the following combined characters: sensilli long with narrow pedicel and sickle-like head, covered with small spines; rostral setae procumbent; exobothridial setae not vestigial; anterodorsal part of notogaster protrudent to form a hook-like projection covering posterior part of prodorsum; setae h of mentum slightly longer than distance between them; genital setae with formula: 7 ( 4 + 3 ): 2 ; setae d on femora I forked distally.
